thread.title: Baker Hughes reports September rig counts
thread.title_full: Baker Hughes reports September rig counts

title: Baker Hughes reports September rig counts
text:
Baker Hughes reports September rig counts October 8, 2015 
The international rig count for September was 1,140, up 3 from the 1,137 counted in August, and down 183 from the 1,323 counted in September 2014, according to Baker Hughes Inc. (NYSE: BHI). The international offshore rig count for September was 268, down 2 from the 270 counted in August, and down 65 from the 333 counted in September 2014. 
The average US rig count for September was 848, down 35 from the 883 counted in August, and down 1,082 from the 1,930 counted in September 2014. The average Canadian rig count for September was 183, down 23 from the 206 counted in August, and down 223 from the 406 counted in September 2014. 
The worldwide rig count for September was 2,171, down 55 from the 2,226 counted in August, and down 1,488 from the 3,659 counted in September 2014. Cameron appoints Rowe as president and CEO 10/06/2015 
Cameron has appointed R. Scott Rowe as president and CEO, effective Oct. 5. Rowe has served with Cameron for 13 years, most recently as president and COO. Halliburton and Baker Hughes to sell additional businesses prior to merger 09/28/2015 
Halliburton and Baker Hughes will market for sale additional businesses in connection with Halliburton’s pending acquisition of Baker Hughes. 09/16/2015 Maana, which provides search engine technology for big-data-fueled solutions, has expanded its team serving the oil and gas industry. Former Chevron executive Peter Breunig will form and chair Maan... More Oil & Gas Financial Articles Cameron appoints Rowe as president and CEO Tue, Oct 6, 2015 
Cameron has appointed R. Scott Rowe as president and CEO, effective Oct. 5. Rowe has served with Cameron for 13 years, most recently as president and COO. Miller Energy files for Chapter 11 reorganization Mon, Oct 5, 2015 
Miller Energy Resources Inc. and certain of its subsidiaries have filed voluntary petitions for reorganization under Chapter 11 of the US Bankruptcy Code in the US Bankruptcy Court for the District of Alaska. Prysmian Group acquires Gulf Coast Downhole Technologies Fri, Oct 2, 2015 
Prysmian Group, which is active in the energy and telecom cable systems industry, has signed an agreement to acquire 100% of the privately held Gulf Coast Downhole Technologies (GCDT) for an initial consideration, subject to adjustment, of $45 million in cash. Report: Oilfield equipment market worth $127.6 billion by 2020 Tue, Sep 29, 2015 
The global oilfield equipment market size is expected to reach US$127.6 billion by 2020, according to a new report by Grand View Research Inc. Continuous technological advancements in tools for better performance, improved recovery rate, and higher production is expected to drive the global industry demand over the forecast period. Halliburton and Baker Hughes to sell additional businesses prior to merger Mon, Sep 28, 2015 
Halliburton and Baker Hughes will market for sale additional businesses in connection with Halliburton’s pending acquisition of Baker Hughes.
